intro: Epacris pumila, commonly known as the dwarf epacris, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the heath family, Ericaceae, and is characterized by its low-growing habit and dense foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. Epacris pumila thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract native pollinators.
